text:
Community Corner
ðŸŒ± Patch AM: Yuma Rotary awards $14K in scholarships
Spotted on the Yuma calendar: Don Friesen - Clean and Hilarious Comedy Show
Hi there, Yuma! We've got your morning read ready! Read on to stay connected. â˜•ï¸ï¸ In today's newsletter:
- Yuma Rotary awards $14K in scholarships
- Bee attack shocks Yuma family
- Yuma County unites for Villareal's family
Also on today's calendar: Don Friesen - Clean and Hilarious Comedy Show and 1 other events.
Today's riddle: What do you call a hairy cushion? ðŸ¤” (Answer below!)
Find out what's happening in Yumafor free with the latest updates from Patch.
- Thursday: Sunny, breezy and very warm, with a high of 106 and low of 74 degrees. ðŸŒ¶ Hot!
- Friday: Mostly sunny and very warm, temps: high: 105, low: 73.
- Saturday: Partly sunny and very warm, with a high of 107 and low of 74 degrees.
ðŸ“° News we're reading
1. Yuma Rotary Club Awards $14K in Higher Ed Scholarships (kawc.org) â€” The Yuma Rotary Club has awarded $14,000 in scholarships to outstanding students from Yuma area high schools. These scholarships, funded by community events, aim to support higher education and youth leadership in the local community.
Find out what's happening in Yumafor free with the latest updates from Patch.
2. Bee attack in Yuma harms family (kyma.com) â€” A family in Yuma is warning others after a devastating bee attack left them shaken and claimed the lives of their two dogs. The family hopes to raise awareness about the dangers of bee swarms.
3. Locals throughout Yuma County raise funds for victim of shooting and arson (kyma.com) â€” Following the tragic death of Leticia Villareal, Yuma County locals are rallying to support her family by raising funds. Community members and businesses have come together, selling merchandise and organizing fundraisers to secure her child's future.
4. Opening statements for twin brothers' Yuma murder trial (kyma.com) â€” The trial of twin brothers accused of murdering a Yuma teen has begun, with opening statements highlighting the events leading to Cesar Aguilar's tragic death. The defense argues self-defense, while prosecutors present evidence of premeditation.
5. Military presence grows near Yuma-Mexico border as security ramps up (azfamily.com) â€” Military vehicles, including MRAPs and Humvees, are now operating near the San Luis Port of Entry in Yuma as part of a joint effort between the Department of Defense and U.S. Border Patrol. This collaboration aims to enhance border security and has resulted in record-low illegal crossings in the Yuma sector.

- **Early Bird Special!
Huge Yard Sale â€“ Starts at 7 AM!** Kick off your Saturday with fantastic deals at our massive yard sale!
